attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHIyZ2NImcXIieGQx9_description
attribs.current: On hit, a Medium or smaller target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be swallowed whole. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained and has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the nightgarm. It takes 21, 6d6, acid damage at the start of each of the nightgarm’s turns. A nightgarm can have only one creature swallowed at a time. If the nightgarm takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the nightgarm must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone within 5 feet of the nightgarm. If the nightgarm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHIyZ2NImcXIieGQxA_description
attribs.current: If a nightgarm spends an entire round consuming a humanoid corpse, it immediately becomes pregnant. Nine hours later, it gives birth to a duplicate of the devoured creature. Known as a ‘falseman,’ this duplicate has all the memories and characteristics of the original but serves its mother loyally, somewhat similar to a familiar’s relationship to a wizard. A nightgarm can have up to 14 falsemen under her control at a time. A nightgarm can communicate telepathically with its falsemen at ranges up to 200 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHIyZ2NImcXIieGQxB_description
attribs.current: Like snakes, nightgarms can open their mouths far wider than other creatures of similar size. This ability grants it a formidable bite and allows it to swallow creatures up to Medium size.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHIyZ3V4r5l6YFudno_description
attribs.current: A nightgarm must stay at least 5 feet away from a brandished holy symbol or a burning sprig of wolf’s bane, and it cannot touch or make melee attacks against a creature holding one of these items. After 1 round, the nightgarm can make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw at the start of each of its turns; if the save succeeds, the nightgarm temporarily overcomes its superstition and these restrictions are lifted until the start of the nightgarm’s next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHIyZ3V4r5l6YFudnp_description
attribs.current: The nightgarm’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:  3/day each: darkness, dissonant whispers, hold person1/day each: conjure woodland beings (wolves only), dimension door, scrying (targets falsemen only)

attribs.name: npc_resistances
attribs.current: lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren’t silvered

attribs.name: npc_languages
attribs.current: Common, Giant, Goblin, telepathy 200 ft. (with falsemen only)

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MUHIygiTJtPCIgOIpNV_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: Bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MUHIygiTJtPCIgOIpNV_spelldescription
attribs.current: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can’t see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can’t illuminate it. If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn’t being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness. If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MUHIygiTJtPCIgOIpNV_spelltarget
attribs.current: A point you choose within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUHIygjHKBU4U2nmlyt_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUHIygjHKBU4U2nmlyt_spelldescription
attribs.current: You whisper a discordant melody that only one creature of your choice within range can hear, wracking it with terrible pain. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3d6 psychic damage and must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from you. The creature doesn’t move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesn’t have to move away. A deafened creature automatically succeeds on the save.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUHIygjHKBU4U2nmlyt_spelltarget
attribs.current: One creature of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-4_-MUHIygkno4MbYxsVo6Z_spelldescription
attribs.current: You teleport yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as “200 feet straight downward” or “upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle, 300 feet.” You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn’t exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell. If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 force damage, and the spell fails to teleport you.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-5_-MUHIygkno4MbYxsVo6a_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A focus worth at least 1,000 gp, such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water

attribs.name: repeating_spell-5_-MUHIygkno4MbYxsVo6a_spelldescription
attribs.current: You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you’re casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed. Knowledge	Save Modifier Secondhand (you have heard of the target)	+5 Firsthand (you have met the target)	+0 Familiar (you know the target well)	−5 Connection	Save Modifier Likeness or picture	−2 Possession or garment	−4 Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like	−10 On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell against it again for 24 hours. On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see invisible objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist. Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-5_-MUHIygkno4MbYxsVo6a_spelltarget
attribs.current: A particular creature you choose that is on the same place of existence as you

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJ-tQ5ZjZqBBph86t_description
attribs.current: The owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJ-tR-dbix02T5IiH_description
attribs.current: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJ22swY7bLAoFHLA8_description
attribs.current: The bereginyas makes two claw attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the target is grappled (escape DC 12) and the bereginyas immediately uses Smother against it as a bonus action.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJ22swY7bLAoFHLAA_description
attribs.current: If the bereginyas grapples an opponent, it extends a semi-solid gaseous tendril down the target’s throat as a bonus action. The target must make a successful DC 14 Strength saving or it is immediately out of breath and begins suffocating. Suffocation ends if the grapple is broken or if the bereginyas is killed.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJ59QtADqe8ZAwwdX_description
attribs.current: The frostveil makes three tendril attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJ59QtADqe8ZAwwdY_description
attribs.current: If two tendrils hit the same target in a single turn, the target is engulfed

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJ59QtADqe8ZAwwdZ_description
attribs.current: In distress, frostveils release a puff of psychotropic spores in a 10-foot cloud around themselves. Creatures within the cloud of spores must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw against poison or suffer hallucinations, as per a confusion spell, for 1d3 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJ59QtADqe8ZAwwda_description
attribs.current: The frostveil’s frozen acidic mist breaks down flesh and organic materials into useable nutrients. Creatures who strike the frostveil with a non-reach melee weapon or an unarmed strike take 4 (1d8) acid damage.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJ59QtADqe8ZAwwdb_description
attribs.current: While the frostveil remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a formation of frost and ice.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJ59QtADqe8ZAwwdc_description
attribs.current: While in blowing wind, the frostveil can fly with a speed of 30 feet. In a strong wind this speed increases to 60 feet.

attribs.name: npc_resistances
attribs.current: bludgeoning and piercing from nonmagical weapons

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJ8C0s27Mf26KrA9U_description
attribs.current: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJ8C1AFjemlEljuaT_description
attribs.current: The worg has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJCUo-8dMG4K9MytA_description
attribs.current: he treant makes three slam attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJCUpmovxUZQ3wK7m_description
attribs.current: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJCUpmovxUZQ3wK7n_description
attribs.current: A weeping treant can converse with plants, and most plants greet them with a friendly or helpful attitude.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJCUpmovxUZQ3wK7o_description
attribs.current: Thick tears of dark sap stream continuously down the treant’s face and trunk. These tears are highly acidic—anyone who attacks the treant from a range of 5 feet or less must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 6 (1d12) acid damage from splashed tears. This acidic matter continues doing 6 (1d12) acid damage at the start of each of the creature’s turns until it or an adjacent ally uses an action to wipe off the tears or three rounds elapse.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJEX8DrbB1Uzl8PHG_description
attribs.current: If the boar moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJEX8DrbB1Uzl8PHH_name
attribs.current: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJEX8DrbB1Uzl8PHH_description
attribs.current: If the boar takes 10 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJHuImFCLImBv7Blk_description
attribs.current: The darakhul bites once, claws once, and makes one war pick attack. Using a shield limits the darakhul to making either its claw or war pick attack, but not both.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJHuImFCLImBv7Bll_description
attribs.current: If the target creature is humanoid it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or contract darakhul fever

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHJHuImFCLImBv7Blm_description
attribs.current: If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must make a successful DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a humanoid creature is paralyzed for 2 or more rounds - the victim fails at least 2 saving throws, consecutive or nonconsecutive, the creature contracts darakhul fever

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJHuImFCLImBv7Blo_description
attribs.current: A darakhul in a prepared disguise has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to pass as a living creature. While using this ability, the darakhul loses its stench.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJHuImFCLImBv7Blp_description
attribs.current: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the darakhul must make a successful DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. A successful saving throw makes the creature immune to the darakhul’s stench for 24 hours. A darakhul using this ability can’t also benefit from Master of Disguise.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJHuImFCLImBv7Blq_description
attribs.current: The darakhul has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on attack rolls while it, the object it is trying to see or attack in direct sunlight.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJHuImFCLImBv7Blr_description
attribs.current: The darakhul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHJxqNFVTCBjEgU70R_description
attribs.current: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+ the damage taken, unless the damage is necrotic or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

attribs.name: npc_languages
attribs.current: understands Common and Giant but can't speak

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHLX3gvLUZrFF6kcbc_description
attribs.current: The mi-go makes two attacks with its claws.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHLX3gvLUZrFF6kcbd_description
attribs.current: On hit, the target is grappled, escape DC 13. If both claw attacks strike the same target in a single turn, the target takes an additional 13, 2d12, psychic damage

attribs.name: repeating_npcreaction_-MUHLX3h0TQNI5jYGgj-_description
attribs.current: When a mi-go dies, it releases its remaining spores. All living creatures within 10 feet take 14 (2d8 + 5) poison damage and become poisoned; a successful DC 16 Constitution saving throw halves the damage and prevents poisoning. A poisoned creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself with a success.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHLX3h0TQNI5jYGgj0_description
attribs.current: Mi-go do not require air or heat to survive, only sunlight (and very little of that). They can enter a sporulated form capable of surviving travel through the void and returning to consciousness when conditions are right.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHLX3h0TQNI5jYGgj1_description
attribs.current: The mi-go does an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a claw attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the mi-go that isn’t incapacitated and the mi-go doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHLX3h0TQNI5jYGgj2_description
attribs.current: The mi-go are a highly advanced race, and may carry items of powerful technology. Mi-go technology can be represented using the same rules as magic items, but their functions are very difficult to determine: identify is useless, but an hour of study and a successful DC 19 Arcana check can reveal the purpose and proper functioning of a mi‑go item.

attribs.name: npc_senses
attribs.current: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 240 ft., passive Perception 15

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHLZgShhOcz8ZHZ5pk_description
attribs.current: The myconid uses either its Deathcap Spores or its Slumber Spores, then makes a fist attack.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHLZgShhOcz8ZHZ5pm_description
attribs.current: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 3 rounds. While poisoned this way, the target also takes 10 (4d4) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUHLZgShhOcz8ZHZ5pn_description
attribs.current: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned and unconscious for 1 minute. A creature wakes up if it takes damage, or if another creature uses its action to shake it awake.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHLZgShhOcz8ZHZ5po_description
attribs.current: When a deathcap myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it sense its pain.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUHLZgTEPXTDLIlCNVy_description
attribs.current: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTQN31mu-VUoZ7Hfd_description
attribs.current: Asgren has advantage on attack rolls if at least one of the dwarf's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTQN4VM3r5zsYwnk4_description
attribs.current: When damage reduces Asgren to 0 hit points, he immediately makes three greatsword or dagger attacks. After making the three attacks, Asgren dies.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTQN5t7wtfr7LaAoB_description
attribs.current: Asgren makes three melee or ranged attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTQN6MUaON2HZJUly_name
attribs.current: Asgren's Command (recharges after a short or long rest)

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTQN6MUaON2HZJUly_description
attribs.current: For 1 minute, Asgren can utter a command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature it can see within 30 feet makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add 1D6 to the roll provided it can hear and understand Asgren. A creature can only benefit from one bonus die at a time. This effect ends if Asgren is incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTQN6MUaON2HZJUlx_attack_tohitrange
attribs.current: +0, Range reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR2EliMaPaXXCUXD_description
attribs.current: The Vors-go raider has advantage on Dexterity saving throws while it is not blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR2EliMaPaXXCUXE_description
attribs.current: The Vors-go raider has advantage on attacks if at least one of the dwarf's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR2EliMaPaXXCUXF_description
attribs.current: At the start of its turn, the Vors-go raider can gain advantage on all melee attack rolls during its turn, but attacks against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR2FiI9512t3Z3wm_description
attribs.current: The Vors-go raider makes two hand-axe attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_npcreaction_-MUPTR2G-VGOnIVp0uoo_description
attribs.current: When damage reduces the Vors-go raider to 0 hit points, it immediately makes two hand-axe attacks. After making the two attacks, it dies.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR2FiI9512t3Z3wn_attack_tohitrange
attribs.current: +0, Range reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR3dPt40DxCFioiB_description
attribs.current: The Vors-go raid leader has advantage on Dexterity saving throws while it is not blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR3dPt40DxCFioiC_description
attribs.current: The Vors-go raid leader has advantage on attacks if at least one of the dwarf's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR3dPt40DxCFioiD_description
attribs.current: The Vors-go raid leader makes three melee or ranged attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR3ecg4IfPaBrZPh_description
attribs.current: For 1 minute, the Vors-go raid leader can utter a command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add 1d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the Vors-go raid leader. A creature can only benefit from one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the Vors-go raid leader is incapacitated. After using this feature for 1 minute, he must finish a short or long rest before using it again.

attribs.name: repeating_npcreaction_-MUPTR3ecg4IfPaBrZPi_description
attribs.current: When damage reduces the Vors-go raid leader to 0 hit points, it immediately makes three melee or ranged attacks. After making the three attacks, it dies.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR3ecg4IfPaBrZPg_attack_tohitrange
attribs.current: +0, Range reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR5RtVcND4ywPr44_description
attribs.current: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR5RtVcND4ywPr45_description
attribs.current: The Vors-go war wolf has advantage on attacks if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR5Sut2D3HDSyZtQ_description
attribs.current: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attribs.name: repeating_npcreaction_-MUPTR5Sut2D3HDSyZtR_description
attribs.current: When damage reduces the Vors-go war wolf to 0 hit points, it immediately makes a bite attack, if a target is available. After making the attack, the war wolf dies.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR7wiNPVkqzjaehV_description
attribs.current: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on Dexterity saving throws against attacks it can see when it is not blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR7xcVceuHSMgGWP_description
attribs.current: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR7xcVceuHSMgGWQ_description
attribs.current: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on attacks if at least one of the dwarf's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUPTR7xcVceuHSMgGWR_description
attribs.current: At the start of its turn, the wolf reaver dwarf can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR7xcVceuHSMgGWS_description
attribs.current: The wolf reaver dwarf makes two melee or ranged attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR7ybI6XNpZjDevo_description
attribs.current: if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR7ybI6XNpZjDevn_attack_tohitrange
attribs.current: +0, Range reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUPTR7ybI6XNpZjDevo_attack_tohitrange
attribs.current: +0, Range reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUVQsmfUymmSgZ6N0h6_description
attribs.current: The next attack roll made against this target before the end of the priest's next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUVQsmfUymmSgZ6N0h7_description
attribs.current: The priest, as a bonus action, creates a floating, spectral weapon within 60 feet that lasts for one minute or until the priest casts this spell again. When the priest casts the spell, it can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. As a bonus action on the priest's turn, it can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUVQsmfUymmSgZ6N0h8_description
attribs.current: As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUVQsmfUymmSgZ6N0h9_description
attribs.current: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:   • Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy • 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary • 2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon • 3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQt06ipi-1EPJiy0l_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQt06ipi-1EPJiy0l_spelltarget
attribs.current: One object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQt073Yw-MWAPOF6y_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQt073Yw-MWAPOF6y_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQt073Yw-MWAPOF6z_spelldescription
attribs.current: You manifest a minor wonder, a sign of supernatural power, within range. You create one of the following magical effects within range: Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQt073Yw-MWAPOF7-_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the Healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQt073Yw-MWAPOF7-_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221N_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221N_spelldescription
attribs.current: A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221N_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221O_spelldescription
attribs.current: You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn’t protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221P_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221Q_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221Q_spelldescription
attribs.current: You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell’s effect resemble that weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221R_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221R_spelldescription
attribs.current: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell’s level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MUVQt08eWJ5LX0q221R_spelltarget
attribs.current: One creature, object, or magical effect within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MUVQt09qFoFLVi3gEZI_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MUVQt09qFoFLVi3gEZI_spelldescription
attribs.current: You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature’s speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUVQva0EtHYRDDtrCeR_description
attribs.current: The acolyte is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The acolyte has following cleric spells prepared:   • Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy • 1st level (3 slots): bless, cure wounds, sanctuary

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQvkas93L5tKOXuAm_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQvkas93L5tKOXuAm_spelltarget
attribs.current: One object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQvkas93L5tKOXuAn_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQvkas93L5tKOXuAn_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUVQvkas93L5tKOXuAo_spelldescription
attribs.current: You manifest a minor wonder, a sign of supernatural power, within range. You create one of the following magical effects within range: Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQvkas93L5tKOXuAp_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQvkas93L5tKOXuAp_spelldescription
attribs.current: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQvkas93L5tKOXuAp_spelltarget
attribs.current: Up to three creatures of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQvkb--UEwlhMdl5k_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the Healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQvkb--UEwlhMdl5k_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUVQvkb--UEwlhMdl5l_spelldescription
attribs.current: You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn’t protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUZ16YbzO43jYbUctB9_description
attribs.current: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

attribs.name: npc_languages
attribs.current: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUZ1NOHMzcCO0wfI-RS_description
attribs.current: If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUZ1NOHMzcCO0wfI-RT_description
attribs.current: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 ft. of the ghast must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the ghast's Stench for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUZ1NOHMzcCO0wfI-RU_description
attribs.current: The ghast and any ghouls within 30 ft. of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUZ1PrqyDFQXMcrTjdp_description
attribs.current: The trollkin raider makes three melee attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite, or two with its battleaxe and one with its handaxe, or it makes two ranged attacks with its handaxes.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUZ1PrswPClq7jKOMDS_description
attribs.current: Using the battleaxe two-handed prevents using the handaxe

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUZ1PrswPClq7jKOMDW_description
attribs.current: Up to three allies who can hear the trollkin reaver and are within 30 feet of it can each make one melee attack as a reaction.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUZ1PrswPClq7jKOMDX_description
attribs.current: The trollkin reaver regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. This trait doesn’t function if the trollkin took acid or fire damage since the end of its previous turn. The trollkin dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUZ1PrswPClq7jKOMDY_description
attribs.current: The trollkin reaver’s skin is thick and tough, granting it a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is already factored into the trollkin’s AC.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUZ1Ugh5adq88S6sKDx_description
attribs.current: If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUZ1Ugi-vPaaJ9z3x8Z_description
attribs.current: The beggar ghoul has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beggar ghoul’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUZ1Ugi-vPaaJ9z3x8a_description
attribs.current: A beggar ghoul that hits with its bite attack against a creature that hasn’t acted yet in this combat scores a critical hit.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUeMbZ2J2WxxvmTBNJC_description
attribs.current: The target creature and all creatures within 10 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or contract stage 2 spore infestation.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUeMbZ2J2WxxvmTBNJD_description
attribs.current: A humanoid creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the bulb gains 1d6 temporary hit points from the alien ovoid’s resonant humming. If the creature remains within 10 feet of the spore bulb for one complete round, the spore bulb drifts into physical contact with the creature at the start of the creature’s next turn, triggering a Touch attack.

attribs.name: npc_condition_immunities
attribs.current: blinded, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, prone

attribs.name: npc_senses
attribs.current: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 5

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MUf9nbAMgjPiiSTWA1W_description
attribs.current: The dwarven ringmage makes two melee attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUf9nbBoimXcMjutKM3_description
attribs.current: The dwarven ringmage has adcantage on saving throws against poison.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUf9nbBoimXcMjutKM4_description
attribs.current: The dwarven ringmage can imbue a nonmagical ring with a spell that has a range of self or touch. Doing so expends components as if the dwarven ringmage had cast the spell normally and uses a spell slot one level higher than the spell normally requires. When the wearer of the ring activates the ring as an action, the spell is cast as if the dwarven ringmage had cast the spell. The dwarven ringmage does not regain the spell slot until the ring is discharged or the dwarven ringmage chooses to dismiss the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUf9nbBoimXcMjutKM5_description
attribs.current:
The dwarven ringmage can use his ring-staff
 as a focus for spells that require rings as a focus or component,
 or for his Ring Magic ability. If used as a focus for Ring Magic,
 the spell does not require a spell slot one level higher than the
 spell normally requires. Once per day, the dwarven ringmage
 can imbue a spell of 4th level or lower into his ring-staff by
 expending a spell slot equal to the spell being imbued.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MUf9nbBoimXcMjutKM6_description
attribs.current: The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:  Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, mage hand, shocking grasp, truestrike1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, magic missile, shield, thunderwave2nd level (3 slots): misty step, web3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, fly4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, ice storm5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUf9noUhXwR5-NknzsM_spelldescription
attribs.current: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn’t being worn or carried. This spell’s damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUf9noUhXwR5-NknzsM_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature or object within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUf9noV-s2zcXUFnZrC_spelldescription
attribs.current: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again. You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it. The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUf9noV-s2zcXUFnZrC_spelltarget
attribs.current: A point you choose within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUf9noV-s2zcXUFnZrD_spelldescription
attribs.current: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage, and it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn.   ​The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MUf9noV-s2zcXUFnZrD_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature you try to touch

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCycl_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCycl_spelldescription
attribs.current: You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCycl_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature of your choice that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCycm_spellcastingtime
attribs.current: 1 reaction, which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCycm_spelldescription
attribs.current: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCycn_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCycn_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCycn_spelldescription
attribs.current: A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCycn_spelltarget
attribs.current: A point you choose within range

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MUf9noW-tEelY7VCyco_itemcontent
attribs.current: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.
